texts.text: When I wake up...
There are tears moistening my eyes.
I scoop them up with my fingers and stare vacantly at them.
The end of Yonagi's dream.
When that time comes, I will know.
That's what Izumo said.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see now.
The stories come to an end when Yonagi and I are separated.
I raise myself up and turn to Yonagi.
She's also shedding silent tears from her closed eyes.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Good morning.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Morning.

texts.name: Shleep
texts.text: *Chirp*

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: The mapping of this dream is complete. We need to send another sensory signal to Yonagi.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Two dreams are left.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: My memories remained this time.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Yes. However, Yonagi's brain processes will switch once we input data originating from another dream.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: This is necessary to ensure the plan is secure and maximize the results.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Which means?

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Her recovery may seem to have regressed, but it's just a superficial change.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Lastly, we will consolidate all the areas of her brain that are activated by each of the three dreams.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And that's the safest and most precise way to save Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Or at least, that's what someone has judged to be the case.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Correct.
I feel a bitter smile form on my face.
I have a pretty good idea of who that someone is by now.

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: Please choose the next dream.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Okay.
